description:
Overview

LeBeau Underwood is a professional comic book inker with a wide variety of skills and experience. Former Marvel and Valiant Comics Art Director Don Perlin served as his mentor. He has been fortunate to have gained knowledge from many great professionals in the comic industry. Various professionals have given him the motivation and direction to reach his goals in the comic industry.

He has inked for several publishers including Marvel Enterprises,DC Comics, Image Comics, Zenescope, Digital Webbing, Dabel Brothers Productions, Angelgate, as well as many other small press publishers.

Past projects include inking Noble Causes, Fantastic Four, Haunt, and G.I. Joe. His style varies and plays to the strengths of the penciler to whom he is assigned to.

He is currently inking issue #1 of Static Shock, over penciler Scott McDaniel for DC Comics. He is also a member of Crimelab Syndicate Studios, under the direction of Danny Miki and Jonathan Glapion.
name: Lebeau Underwood

description:
Kevin Volo is the creator of Pixelstrips.com a webcomic community featuring a wide rage of webcomics from Manga to Sci-Fi to Comedy.  Pixestrips.com not only has the best webcomics online, but also features comic tutorials, articles, and creator interviews. All the content on Pixelstrips.com is free, all comics, archives, turorials, everything!

Kevin is also the creator of Big Iron, a western that started as a comic on Pixelstrips.com and is now being offered as a full color comic, with a forward by Jimmy Palmiotti, writer of Jonah Hex, and a cover by DC comic’s exclusive artist Mike Norton. It can be purchased at www.indyplanet.com.

He has also been a colorist for Ape Entertainments Athena Voltaire, the colorist for FC9's Genie, Alias's Ted Noddleman: Bicycle Delivery Boy, and his own web comics Husk, Splash Page, and Big Iron. Some of Volo's other work includes Image Comics' Noble Causes, Round Table of America, Invincible title, and numerous editions of Angel Gate Press's Black Tide.
name: Kevin Volo

deck: The creator of Gargoyles. He was also the supervising director of the Spectacular Spiderman and a producer of The Young Justice animated series.
description:
Greg Weisman is a comic book artist, animation producer and writer best known for shows like The Spectacular Spider-Man, W.I.T.C.H. and Young Justice. He has also worked for shows such as Kim Possible, Ben 10, The Batman and several other shows.

Personal Life

Weisman is a former English and writing teacher and received his degrees from the Stanford University and USC. He is influenced by the style of William Shakespeare and has used it in his own works as well.

Career

At the age of 22, Weisman wrote a four issue mini-series for DC Comics starring Black Canary but the project was ultimately shelved as the character was being used on Mike Grell's Green Arrow series.

In 2001, he also directed an English dub of Japanese anime OVA 3x3 Eyes .

He is responsible for developing and producing the popular series Gargoyles, the second season of W.I.T.C.H. and The Spectacular Spider-Man series. He has worked with several other developers including Victor Cook on the Spectacular Spider-Man, Frank Paur and currently on Young Justice with Brandon Vietti. He has also provided voices for several characters including Donald Menken on The Spectacular Spider-Man and Lucas Snapper Carr on Young Justice.

Weisman also wrote the script for DC Showcase Green Arrow that is a short included in the film Superman/Batman: Apocalypse.
name: Greg Weisman

description:
Early life

Çınar was born in Turkey. In 1994 he graduated from Anadolu Fine Arts High School in Ankara, where he studied fine arts and graphics. He then studied cartoon animation up until 2000 at Anadolu University in Eskişehir.

Career

Although Çınar worked in the field of animation for commercial films, his real creative interest was on comic books.

He helped create a photocopy-fanzine publishing group called Capa Comics group in 1997, to which he has continued to contribute up until today from time to time. Capa Comics group has established links with several bigger publishers today and both Yildiray and his colleagues have published their work in national magazines on several occasions, under common banners of Capa Comics group and the other publisher.

His creations from this time include Sürgün, Maskeli, Son Kahraman, Karabasan and İman Limited.

Although remaining in Istanbul, Çınar started producing for the American comic book market. He was first hooked up with Digital Webbing Press and illustrated stories of Nothingface and Fist of Justice which appeared in numerous issues of the anthology Digital Webbing Presents. He has also produced the art for a graphic novel published by Digital Webbing titled Nothingface.

His Image Comics work began started with a pin-up he draw for Savage Dragon #118. He subsequently illustrated a short story for Savage Dragon #126.

He later worked on Jay Faerber's Image series Noble Causes, on which he served as regular penciler beginning with #27.

After working on the DC Comics series Teen Titans, he began as the regular artist on Legion of Super-Heroes, which debuted in 2010 under veteran Legion writer Paul Levitz.

Currently he is the artist of the new Firestorm book alongside with the two writers Gail Simone and Ethan Van Sciver.

As of Issue #26 Yildiray Cinar has taken over Supergirl for DC Comics.
name: Yildiray Cinar

deck: Writer of Green Lantern: Ganthet's Tale & A.R.M.
description: Larry Niven, one of the most honored and respected science-fiction writers in the world, was born in 1938 in Los Angeles. At age 20, after discovering a book store jammed with used science-fiction magazines, he decided that he wanted to be a writer. Six years later, he had his first professional fiction sale, "The Coldest Place," published in the December, 1964 issue of Worlds of If. Two years after that, he won the first of his five Hugo Awards for the short story "Neutron Star." He has also won a Nebula (for the novel Ringworld) and numerous other awards, including an honorary Doctor of Letters from his alma mater, Washburn University. His current interests include science-fiction conventions, computerized games, comics, and "gatherings of people at the cutting edge of the sciences." He lives in Tarzana, California, with his wife, Marilyn.
name: Larry Niven

deck: A rising artist in the comics industry who applies the anime/manga style to American comics.
description:
Amy Reeder Hadley, also credited as just "Amy Reeder," can be found on both deviantART and blogging. With her Halloween Eve and Rocket Girl collaborator, writer Brandon Montclare, she also podcasts at podcornpodcast.com. She has worked for DC, Image, and TokyoPop, among others, hailed as a rising star in the industry. Her art style is very detailed without being "too busy."

.
name: Amy Reeder Hadley

deck: Artist.  Has worked on Archie Comics, Simpsons Comics, and Marvel Comics.
description: Bil Galvan currently draws for Archie Comics as a freelance penciler. He penciled the 5 issue mini-series Archie:Freshman Year, and has also penciled for Bongo Comics (Simpsons Super Spectacular #7, Bart Simpson #45) and Marvel Comics (The Age of the Sentry #5 "Saved by the Wail"). Bill also co-created The Scrapyard Detectives, a comic book series that is published by a non profit, The Diversity Foundation. Scrapyard Detectives #4 was published in February 2009 and was penciled by Bill and written by JM DeMatteis.
name: Bill Galvan

deck: Writer and artist.  Responsible for the brilliant Herobear and the Kid.
description:
Kunkel is the winner of two Eisner awards for his work on the series, "Herobear and the Kid." He is, in his own words, a "designer, animator, story artist, children's book creator, writer, director. . .and occasional water balloon tosser and frequent food taster." Kunkel is also the man behind his own comicbook company, Astonish Comics. Most of his work is targeted to children of all ages, (including the frequent inner child in all of us.) Incredibly talented as a writer as well as a comicbook artist, Kunkel has, through his work managed to target a children's audience while creating comicbooks that even adults can enjoy. His work includes, "Herobear and the Kid;" "Grommitts;" "The Land of Sokmunster;" and "Flipped." He is presently working on a series sponsored by DC comics called "Billy Batson and the Magic of Shazam!"
Mike was a animation teacher at Laguna College of Art and Design, LCAD, until, about, 2001.  Collaborated with Judd Winick on a Cartoon Network cartoon called "Juniper Lee."  Mike was the shows Lead Character Designer.
name: Mike Kunkel

deck: Past-president of Marvel and one ot the creators of the Ultimate Marvel Universe.
description:
Brief History

Bill Jemas was responsible for the uprising of Marvel in the early 2000's and revamped or retooled many mayor characters. Examples are; the Hulk became a runaway, the X-men got black leather costumes, Cable became Soldier X, Deadpool became Agent X, the origin of Wolverine was told, Spider-man started a new chapter, the start of the Ultimate Comics line. the start of Max Comics and the revamped Epic Line. Most comics where huge succeses, although some ideas failed to catch on (like the Tsunami Comics line) and where soon cancelled. Due to his stricked publishing policies and ethics, Jemas did not stay president for long. His legacy however was build on for years to come.
name: Bill Jemas

deck: Screenwriter/director, author of graphic novels & comic books, television producer, film director.   Has written The Black Forest, The Wicked West and the upcoming Chopper Zombie.
name: Todd Livingston

deck: Crime novelist and comic book writer.
description:
Victor Gischler is an American comic book writer, whose work has been published by Marvel, Dark Horse, Dynamite, and Titan.

Gischler holds a Ph D from the University of Southern Mississippi. He has also taught at the university level, notably at Rogers State University in Claremore, Oklahoma. His fiction has won prestigious literary awards; Gun Monkeys, which earned him an Edgar Award nomination, has been optioned for adaptation into a film. His novels have been translated into several languages, as well. Regardless of whether he is writing crime fiction or in another genre, his work has been characterized as humorous.

Other fiction titles include Suicide Squeeze. The Pistol Poets, Shotgun Opera, Vampire A Go-Go, Go-Go Girls of the Apocalypse, and The Deputy. He also keeps an online blog, available to your right.

In spite of writing various Deadpool titles, Gischler is married. His wife's name is Jackie.
name: Victor Gischler

deck: American writer best known for his television work.
description:
Career

Zev Borow began work as an intern at Rolling Stone. He later moved to San Francisco to work for Might Magazine, which went out of business in 1997. He returned to New York after Might folded, and worked for some time as a freelance writer, penning articles for GQ, the Los Angeles Times, Newsweek, The New Yorker, Spin, Vibe and Wired. Between one and two years following his return to New York, he was approached by a representative of Spyglass Entertainment who offered him an opportunity to write a pilot for a television show about a magazine writer. This show never made it to air, nor did the subsequent two pilots that he wrote. After struggling for some time with the business of writing television shows, he joined the creative team of the television show Chuck in 2007. He worked as a story editor and writer, and also co-wrote the Chuck tie-in comic book series. He left the show in 2010 to act as executive producer for the television show Human Target, which has since been cancelled.

Personal Life

Borow currently lives in Rockville, California with his wife, Chloe.
name: Zev Borow

deck: Kristian Donaldson is an artist currently working with Brian Wood on The Massive.
